Race.SpecificTitle: Constable -- Justice of the Peace District 5
PW-Parish Council(#1) -- Prop.#1 - 1% S&U Tax - PC
Race.SummaryText:
Proposition No. 1 
(Sales Tax)

Summary:  1% sales and use tax for any lawful corporate purpose in the municipalities of Lutcher and Gramercy and for constructing, acquiring, extending, improving, operating and maintaining sewers and sewage disposal facilities in the Parish and acquiring equipment therefor, subject to funding into bonds.
Race.FullText: Shall the Parish of St. James, State of Louisiana (the "Parish"), under the provisions of Article VI, Section 29 of the Constitution of the State of Louisiana of 1974, and other constitutional and statutory authority supplemental thereto, be authorized to levy and collect, and adopt an ordinance providing for such levy and collection, a tax of one percent (1%) (the "Tax") upon the sale at retail, the use, the lease or rental, the consumption, the storage for use or consumption, of tangible personal property and on sales of services in the District, all as presently defined in R.S. 47:301 through 47:317 (an estimated $4,000,000 reasonably expected at this time to be collected parishwide from the levy of the tax for an entire year), with the proceeds of the Tax (after paying reasonable and necessary costs and expenses of collecting and administering the Tax) to be allocated between the Parish and the municipalities of Lutcher and Gramercy (the "Municipalities") so that the Tax proceeds collected in each of the Municipalities shall accrue to each respective Municipality to be dedicated for expenditure by the Municipalities for any lawful corporate purpose and Tax proceeds collected within the unincorporated areas of the Parish shall accrue to the Parish to be dedicated and used by the Parish for the purpose of constructing, acquiring, extending, improving, operating and maintaining sewers and sewage disposal facilities in the Parish and acquiring equipment therefor; and further, shall the Parish and the Municipalities be authorized to fund the proceeds of the Tax into bonds to be issued in series from time to time for paying the cost of making the capital improvements for the purposes herein authorized to the extent and in the manner permitted by the laws of Louisiana, including particularly, Sub-Part F, Part III, Chapter 4, Title 39 of the Louisiana Revised Statutes of 1950?

Race.SpecificTitle: PW-Parish Council(#2) -- Prop.#2 - $1,500,000 Bond - PC - 20 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Proposition No. 2 
(General Obligation Bond)

Summary:  Authority to issue $1,500,000 of 20-year general obligation bonds of the Parish for constructing, acquiring and improving public buildings, (including acquiring and constructing of a Twenty-Third Judicial District Court Administrative Building for the housing of District Judges, the District Attorney, facilities for jury members, witnesses, holding of prisoners for court appearances and housing other administrative staff and personnel); renovating and improving the existing courthouse buildings and providing for adequate parking and furnishings therefor, said bonds to be payable from ad valorem taxes.
Race.FullText: Shall the Parish of St. James, State of Louisiana (the "Parish"), incur debt and issue bonds to the amount of One Million Five Hundred Thousand Dollars ($1,500,000), to run up to twenty (20) years from date thereof, with interest at a rate not exceeding seven per centum (7%) per annum, for the purpose of constructing, acquiring and improving public buildings, (including acquiring and constructing of a Twenty-Third Judicial District Court Administrative Building for the housing of District Judges, the District Attorney, facilities for jury members, witnesses, holding of prisoners for court appearances and housing other administrative staff and personnel); renovating and improving the existing courthouse buildings and providing for adequate parking and furnishings therefor, title to which shall be in the public, said bonds will be general obligations of the Parish and will be payable from ad valorem taxes to be levied and collected in the manner provided by Article VI, Section 33 of the Constitution of the State of Louisiana of 1974 and statutory authority supplemental thereto?
